intro: Goniothalamus tamirensis var. kamputensis, commonly known as the Kamputensis Goniothalamus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo, specifically in the state of Sarawak. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces berries that are typically yellow or red when mature, containing several seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
